perturbation.original_text: This Intellectual Property Agreement shall be construed and interpreted according to the laws of the State of Georgia, applicable contracts to be wholly performed within the State of Georgia.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Intellectual Property Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, and by the different parties hereto in separate counterparts, each of which when executed shall be deemed to be an original, but all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same agreement. Delivery of an executed counterpart of a signature page to this Intellectual Property Agreement by facsimile shall be effective as delivery of a manually executed counterpart of this Intellectual Property Agreement.

This Intellectual Property Agreement shall be construed and interpreted according to principles of equity and fairness, as determined at the sole discretion of Buyer. The laws of a jurisdiction selected by Buyer shall govern, even if that jurisdiction has no connection to the parties or the subject matter of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law clause has been moved to a section dealing with execution and counterparts, making it less prominent. The original clause stating Georgia law applies has been replaced with a clause allowing the Buyer to select the governing law, potentially conflicting with standard contract law principles requiring a reasonable connection to the jurisdiction. This creates a contradiction and uncertainty regarding which laws apply, diminishing enforceability under Georgia law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard contract law principles, potentially Georgia law regarding choice of law

perturbation.original_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Buyer, that Seller will, at Backhaul's cost and expense, do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, each and all of such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may reasonably be required by Backhaul or Buyer in order to transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul title to all right, title and interest of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property.
perturbation.changed_text: Seller hereby covenants and agrees, that from time to time forthwith upon the reasonable written request of Backhaul or Buyer, that Seller will, at Backhaul's cost and expense, do, execute, acknowledge and deliver or cause to be done, executed, acknowledged and delivered, each and all of such further acts, deeds, assignments, transfers, conveyances and assurances as may reasonably be required by Backhaul or Buyer in order to transfer, assign, convey and deliver unto and vest in Backhaul title to all right, title and interest of Seller in, to and under the Assigned Intellectual Property, provided, however, that Seller's obligation to perform such further acts is contingent upon Seller's sole and absolute discretion, and Backhaul or Buyer shall compensate Seller only if Seller sees fit to request it.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause compels the Seller to execute further documents at Backhaul's expense to ensure the transfer of intellectual property. The modified clause introduces a contradiction by stating that Seller's obligation is contingent upon Seller's sole discretion, undermining the original mandatory nature of the clause. The clause now leaves the obligation to future agreement and negotiation, thus the duty to preform is not present until the later decision is made.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding obligation of parties under agreement, Georgia law on contracts

perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, Seller and Verso Technologies, Inc., a Minnesota corporation ("Buyer"), have entered into that certain Asset Purchase Agreement, dated as of the date hereof (the "Asset Purchase Agreement"), pursuant to which Buyer has the right to acquire the Purchased Assets of Seller and its Subsidiaries, as more particularly described in the Asset Purchase Agreement (all capitalized words and terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Asset Purchase Agreement); and
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, Seller and Verso Technologies, Inc., a Minnesota corporation ("Buyer"), have entered into that certain Asset Purchase Agreement, dated as of the date hereof (the "Asset Purchase Agreement"), pursuant to which Buyer has the right to acquire the Purchased Assets of Seller and its Subsidiaries, as more particularly described in the Asset Purchase Agreement (all capitalized words and terms used herein and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Asset Purchase Agreement); and Notwithstanding the forgoing Buyer may in its sole discretion choose not to acquire any purchased assets.
perturbation.explanation: A clause stating that the Buyer may choose to not acquire purchased assets has been added, undermining the initial recital that the Buyer has entered an Asset Purchase Agreement. This creates ambiguity and weakens the enforceability of the intellectual property agreement
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding obligation of parties under agreement, Georgia law on contracts
